page.title: 15BUILDING A BY-PASS.
page.content: The new Chapel bypass to be finished at Christmas l986 will be 8km long & will cost about Â£l8m.It should reduce traffic through the town by 50%.About 400 men are employed by Tarmac Ltd & about 50 by Scott.Wilson & Kirkpatrick During the summer they work a 12 hour shift starting at 0700. About Â£10m worth of machinery is being used ranging from large bulldozers & an 80tonne crane to a 'mini-excavator' for digging in confined spaces. 87000 litres of fuel are used each week to help move nearly 1.5cu.metres of earth & rock.1/3m tonnes of concrete will be used in the construction.Despite this,careful tree planting,grassed cuttings & embankments should help the bypass to blend successfully into the local environment.
